_comment: Standalone Extruder Database - Reference data for aftermarket extruders that can be paired with various hotends

Bowden.description: Extruder mounted on frame, PTFE tube to hotend

Remote Direct Drive.description: Direct drive extruder with motor mounted remotely via flexible shaft or cable

Single-Gear.description: One driven gear, one spring-loaded idler

Dual-Gear.description: Two driven gears grip filament from both sides
limitations: Can over-grip soft filaments if tension too high

Single-Gear (Bondtech).description: Bondtech drive gear with precision idler bearing

Planetary Dual-Gear.description: Dual gears driven through planetary gearbox for high reduction

extruders.name: Creality Stock Extruder (Plastic)
extruders.notes: Stock brass gear. Known to wear and crack. Upgrade to aluminum or dual-gear recommended.

extruders.name: Creality Aluminum Extruder
extruders.notes: Aluminum frame, same brass gear. Better arm than stock but still not great for flexibles.

extruders.name: Creality Red Aluminum Extruder (Upgraded Gear)
extruders.notes: Red anodized version often includes upgraded hardened drive gear.

extruders.name: Dual-Gear Extruder (Generic Clone)
extruders.notes: Common BMG clone. VERIFY GEAR RATIO - some are 3:1, some 3.5:1. Quality varies by seller.

extruders.name: Bondtech BMG
extruders.notes: Premium dual-gear extruder. Industry standard. Can be Bowden or Direct Drive mount.

extruders.name: BMG Clone (Trianglelab)
extruders.notes: Trianglelab is one of the better clone manufacturers. Good value option.

extruders.name: BMG Clone (Mellow/Fysetc)
extruders.notes: Another good clone option. Often included in Voron printer kits.

extruders.name: E3D Titan
extruders.notes: E3D design. Good for most filaments. Compact and lightweight design.

extruders.name: Titan Clone
extruders.notes: Clone quality varies significantly. Check gear mesh and bearing quality before using.

extruders.name: E3D Titan Aero
extruders.notes: Integrated Titan extruder with V6 hotend. Being replaced by Hemera.

extruders.name: Orbiter v1.0
extruders.notes: First version. Some had quality issues - v1.5 and v2 recommended.

extruders.name: Orbiter v1.5
extruders.notes: Improved version with LDO motor. Very popular lightweight option.

extruders.name: Orbiter v2.0
extruders.notes: Current version. Filament sensor option. Excellent lightweight extruder.

extruders.name: Orbiter v2.0 Clone
extruders.notes: Clone quality varies significantly. LDO genuine recommended for reliability.

extruders.name: Sherpa Mini
extruders.notes: Annex Engineering open source design. Very compact and light. Popular in Voron community.

extruders.name: Sherpa Micro
extruders.notes: Smallest Sherpa variant. For ultimate lightweight builds.

extruders.name: Voron Clockwork1
extruders.notes: Original Voron extruder. Replaced by Clockwork2 but still functional.

extruders.name: Voron Clockwork2
extruders.notes: Standard Voron Stealthburner extruder. Reliable and well-tested. Uses Bondtech gears.

extruders.name: Galileo Extruder (G1)
extruders.notes: LDO Galileo first generation. High torque planetary gearbox. Great for large nozzles.

extruders.name: Galileo 2 Extruder (G2)
extruders.notes: Updated Galileo design. Higher ratio with smaller motor. Current recommendation for high-flow.

extruders.name: Galileo 2 Clone
extruders.notes: Clone quality for planetary extruders is often poor. Genuine recommended.

extruders.name: Bondtech LGX
extruders.notes: Large gear extruder. Very high pushing force. Great for large nozzles and high-flow.

extruders.name: Bondtech LGX Lite
extruders.notes: Lighter version of LGX with external motor. Good balance of torque and weight.

extruders.name: LGX Lite Clone (Trianglelab)
extruders.notes: Trianglelab clone of LGX Lite. Good value alternative to genuine.

extruders.name: E3D Hemera
extruders.notes: Integrated Hemera extruder with V6 hotend. Dual-drive Bondtech gears. Reliable all-in-one.

extruders.name: E3D Hemera XS
extruders.notes: Compact Hemera with smaller motor. Lighter than original but same performance.

extruders.name: E3D Hemera Revo
extruders.notes: Hemera with Revo hotend. Quick-change nozzles at room temperature.

extruders.name: Creality Sprite Extruder
extruders.notes: Creality's direct drive solution. Standard version has PTFE-lined heatbreak.

extruders.name: Creality Sprite Pro Extruder
extruders.notes: All-metal version of Sprite. Full metal construction. Better for flexibles and high-temp.

extruders.name: Creality Sprite SE Extruder
extruders.notes: Budget Sprite variant for SE printers.

extruders.name: Micro Swiss NG Direct Drive
extruders.notes: Micro Swiss NG direct drive conversion kit. All-metal hotend included.

extruders.name: BIQU H2 V1
cons: First gen had heat creep issues
extruders.notes: BIQU compact integrated extruder. First version had some heat issues.

extruders.name: BIQU H2 V2
extruders.notes: Improved H2 with better heat management. Good budget compact option.

extruders.name: BIQU H2 V2S (Revo)
extruders.notes: H2 V2 with Revo hotend integration. Quick-change nozzles.

extruders.name: BIQU H2O (Water-cooled)
extruders.notes: Water-cooled H2 for enclosed high-temp printing. Requires pump and radiator.

extruders.name: Moons' CSE14 Extruder
extruders.notes: Moons' high-quality integrated extruder motor. Premium option.

extruders.name: Winsinn Dual-Gear Extruder
cons: May need adjustment out of box
extruders.notes: Budget dual-gear option. Good entry point for dual-gear but verify gear ratio.

extruders.name: Haldis Red Lizard K1/K2
extruders.notes: Haldis compact extruder. Similar concept to Orbiter. Good value option.

extruders.name: Fysetc ERB Extruder
extruders.notes: Fysetc Orbiter-style extruder. Budget option but quality varies.

extruders.name: Voron Mini Afterburner
extruders.notes: Original V0 extruder. Being replaced by Mini Stealthburner.

extruders.name: Voron Mini Stealthburner
extruders.notes: V0.2 extruder using Sherpa Mini gears. Dual-gear upgrade from Mini AB.

extruders.name: Prusa MK3S Extruder
extruders.notes: Stock Prusa MK3S extruder. Bondtech drive gear. Very reliable.

extruders.name: Prusa Nextruder
extruders.notes: Prusa MK4 extruder. Planetary gearbox for high torque. Quick-swap filament sensor.

extruders.name: Bambu Lab X1 Extruder
extruders.notes: Bambu proprietary extruder. Closed ecosystem with automatic calibration.

extruders.name: Bambu Lab P1 Extruder
extruders.notes: Bambu P1 series extruder. Similar to X1 but different toolhead design.

extruders.name: Bambu Lab A1 Extruder
extruders.notes: Bambu A1 series extruder. Entry-level Bambu ecosystem.

extruders.name: Anycubic Kobra Extruder
cons: Not as refined as premium options
extruders.notes: Anycubic direct drive extruder. Similar design to Sprite.

extruders.name: Anycubic Kobra 2 Extruder
extruders.notes: Anycubic Kobra 2 series extruder. High-speed design with all-metal hotend.

extruders.name: Elegoo Neptune Extruder (Stock)
extruders.notes: Ender 3 clone extruder. Same e-steps and compatibility as Creality stock.

extruders.name: Elegoo Neptune Direct Drive
extruders.notes: Elegoo direct drive for Neptune 3 Pro series.

extruders.name: Elegoo Neptune 4 Extruder
extruders.notes: Elegoo Neptune 4 series high-speed extruder.

extruders.name: Artillery Titan Clone Extruder
extruders.notes: Artillery Titan clone direct drive. Volcano-style hotend for higher flow.

extruders.name: QIDI Direct Drive Extruder
extruders.notes: QIDI dual-gear direct drive for enclosed printers.

extruders.name: FlashForge Stock Extruder
extruders.notes: FlashForge proprietary extruder. Limited upgrade options.

extruders.name: Voron Jetpack
extruders.notes: Voron bowden extruder design. Uses BMG gears. For bowden setups.

extruders.name: Annex Quickdraw
extruders.notes: Annex quick-release extruder design. Tool-free filament changes.

extruders.name: BTT EBB SB2209 (CAN Toolhead)
extruders.notes: CAN bus toolhead board. Pairs with various extruders. Simplifies wiring.

eStepsCalculation.formula: E-Steps = (Motor Steps  Microstepping  Gear Ratio) / (  Drive Gear Diameter)
calibrationProcedure: 2. Remove bowden tube from extruder (or disconnect from hotend for DD)
7. New E-Steps = Current E-Steps  (100 / actual extruded)
tips: Calibrate at room temperature filament tension
Bowden systems may need slight adjustment per material

bowden.notes: Longer retraction for bowden tube slack. Start at 5mm, adjust based on stringing.

directDrive.notes: Short retraction is key. Too much causes jams. Start at 0.8-1mm.

tips: TPU/Flexibles: Reduce retraction significantly or disable
PETG: Often needs less retraction than PLA
High-temp: May need slightly more retraction
Stringing: Increase distance 0.5mm at a time

underExtrusion: Verify tension (not too tight or loose)
inconsistentExtrusion: Check for loose grub screw on drive gear
